findings.Description: The security group allows RDP access from 0.0.0.0/0 on port 3389.
Types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/AWS-Foundational-Security-Best-Practices
findings.Title: Security group allows unrestricted RDP access (0.0.0.0/0)

findings.Description: IAM policy grants full administrative privileges (*:*). Follow principle of least privilege.
Types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/AWS-Foundational-Security-Best-Practices
findings.Title: IAM policy allows full administrative privileges

findings.Description: Root account access keys should not exist. Remove access keys and use IAM users instead.
Types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/AWS-Foundational-Security-Best-Practices
findings.Title: IAM root account access keys exist

findings.Description: RDS DB instances should have encryption at rest enabled for data protection.
Types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/AWS-Foundational-Security-Best-Practices
findings.Title: RDS DB instance is not encrypted

findings.Description: Lambda functions should run within a VPC to access private resources securely.
Types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/AWS-Foundational-Security-Best-Practices
findings.Title: Lambda function is not in a VPC

findings.Description: Route53 logs show domain generation algorithm (DGA) patterns with rapid queries to non-existent random domains.
findings.Title: High volume DNS queries indicating DGA activity
